title: A Step-by-Step Guide to Finding Fortnite Game Files

steps.title: Open File Explorer .
steps.content: Open File Explorer . You'll find this application icon in your taskbar or Start menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click next to This PC.
steps.content: Click next to This PC . You'll see "This PC" in the panel on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Local Disc (C:).
steps.content: Click Local Disc (C:) . It's next to an icon of a hard drive and a Windows icon.

steps.title: Double-click Users.
steps.content: Double-click Users . You'll see this in the list of folders inside the C: drive.

steps.title: Double-click your name.
steps.content: Double-click your name. You want to access the information stored with your profile, so you'll need to select your name here.

steps.title: Double-click AppData.
steps.content: Double-click AppData . This folder is usually hidden by default, so you may need to unhide them . [2] X Research source To show hidden folders, open "File Explorer Options," click the View tab and click Show hidden files, folders, and drives . [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Double-click Local.
steps.content: Double-click Local . This is usually the first folder in the menu.

steps.title: Double-click FortniteGame.
steps.content: Double-click FortniteGame . The list is usually in alphabetical order.

steps.title: Double-click Saved and Logs.
steps.content: Double-click Saved and Logs . You'll see all the data associated with your Fortnite Game. [4] X Research source If you want to make a ZIP file , you need to select all the files you want to include in the ZIP, then right-click and select Send to > Compressed (zipped) folder . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . You'll see this app icon in your Dock.

steps.title: Click Library and Logs.
steps.content: Click Library and Logs . You'll find "Library" in the panel on the left side of the window and "Logs" on the right.

steps.title: Double-click Fortnite Game.
steps.content: Double-click Fortnite Game . You'll see all the data associated with your Fortnite Game. [6] X Research source If you want to make a ZIP file , select all the files you want to include in the ZIP, then right-click it and select Compress . [7] X Research source
